security_audit.summary: Legitimate PowerPoint automation skill using python-pptx library. Static findings are false positives: code examples in markdown were misidentified as shell commands, cryptographic references in documentation were flagged as weak algorithms, and API data fetching for bulk generation was mischaracterized as credential access. No malicious behavior detected. All functionality aligns with stated purpose.

medium_findings.title: Filesystem access for PPTX creation
medium_findings.description: Legitimate file operations for reading and writing PowerPoint files. Required for stated purpose.

medium_findings.title: Network call in API example
medium_findings.description: Documented example demonstrates fetching data from APIs for bulk generation. Legitimate use case.

content.value_statement: Need to create professional presentations from data or templates. This skill generates PowerPoint files with charts, images, tables, and custom formatting using Python code.
actual_capabilities: Create new PowerPoint presentations with custom dimensions and layouts
Add slides with titles, bullet points, images, charts, and tables
Apply brand colors, fonts, and themes to presentations
Generate multiple slides from CSV, JSON, or database data
Add charts with bar, line, pie, and area visualizations
limitations: Cannot edit animations or transitions programmatically
Limited support for creating custom slide layouts from scratch
Requires user to provide image files that exist on disk

use_cases.title: Automated report generation
use_cases.description: Generate monthly business reports with charts and data tables from spreadsheet data

use_cases.title: Bulk presentation creation
use_cases.description: Create individual presentations for multiple clients or products from template and data

use_cases.title: Data visualization slides
use_cases.description: Convert charts and analysis results into professional presentation format

output: - Revenue chart: bar chart showing quarterly comparison

best_practices: Optimize images before adding them to reduce file size
Use consistent formatting and brand colors across all slides
Validate data before creating charts to ensure correct display
anti_patterns: Adding images without checking if the file exists first
Using low-resolution images that appear blurry on screen
Creating slides with too much text or too many bullet points

faq.question: Which PowerPoint formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with .pptx files. It creates files compatible with Microsoft PowerPoint 2007 and later versions.

faq.question: What chart types can I create?
faq.answer: Supported chart types include bar, column, line, pie, area, stacked bar, and line with markers. Each can be customized with legends, labels, and colors.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with existing templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Load your template file using Presentation('template.pptx') and all master slide formatting will be preserved when adding new slides.

faq.question: Is my data safe when generating presentations?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only accesses files you explicitly specify. Data from external sources like CSV or APIs is processed locally before creating the presentation.

faq.question: Why do my images appear blurry?
faq.answer: Use high-resolution images (1920x1080 minimum for screen presentations). The skill includes image optimization functions to resize large images while maintaining quality.

faq.question: How does this compare to other presentation tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses python-pptx for native PowerPoint file generation. Unlike HTML-to-PPT converters, output files are fully editable in Microsoft PowerPoint with all formatting preserved.
